subject: HTML
name: Headings
snippet: The <h1> to <h6> tags are used to define HTML headings. <h1> defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading.

subject: CSS
name: Padding
snippet: The padding clears an area around the content (inside the border) of an element. The padding is affected by the background color of the element.

subject: HTML
name: Unordered List
snippet: An unordered list starts with the <ul> tag. Each list item starts with the <li> tag.The list items are marked with bullets (typically small black circles).

subject: HTML
name: Ordered List
snippet: An ordered list starts with the <ol> tag. Each list item starts with the <li> tag.The list items are marked with numbers

subject: CSS
name: Margin
snippet: The margin clears an area around an element (outside the border). The margin does not have a background color, and is completely transparent. The top, right, bottom, and left margin can be changed independently using separate properties. A shorthand margin property can also be used, to change all margins at once.

subject: CSS
name: Style Ordered List
snippet: An ordered list can have different style. All is set using the list-syle-type property.

subject: CSS
name: Style Unordered List
snippet: An unordered list can have different style. All is set using the list-syle-type property

subject: CSS
name: Display
snippet: The display property defines how a certain HTML element should be displayed.

subject: HTML
name: Tables
snippet: Table are mainly used in Html to create a newsletter and fixed layout.
